title: Agroforestry System
desc: tree planting density and tree spacing, soil depth and tree position accross zone

title: Weather & Environment
desc: Weather parameters rainfall, soil temperature and potential evapotranspiration

title: Plantations
desc: Tree planting density and tree spacing, soil depth and tree position accross zone

desc: Crop Parameters

desc: Tree Parameters

title: Crop Management
desc: Crop planting schedule/cropping calendar

title: Tree Management
desc: Tree planting and management schedule

title: Slash & Burn
desc: The table below contains default values for the slashing schedule and parameters for the impacts of a burning event, depending on the surface temperature during the burn.  Values shown in blue font are default values.

title: Profitability
desc: Profitability

title: Pedotransfer & Soil Hydraulic
desc: Pedotransfer functions for hydraulic properties of soil (adapted from Wosten et al., 1998 and Tomasella-Hodnett)

title: Pedo SOM
desc: The Bulk Density pedotransfer and Soil Organic Matter pedotransfer for generating C organic per C reference value in Soil Organic Matter module

title: Roots & Mycorrhiza
desc: Root Type (Rt_ATType or Rt_ACType): 0 = Lrv data, 1 = constant exponential/elliptical function, 2 = dynamic exponential/elliptical function

title: Root Parasitism
desc: An option is provided for simulating root parasitism by Tree 1 on roots of Tree2, Tree3 or any of the crop (or weed) types. The 'effectiveness' parameter specified here is multiplied with the product of the root length densities (in layer 1 and 2) of the host and the parasite to derive the fraction of roots that is parasitized (in all soil layers) and effectively belongs to (contributes to water and nutrient uptake) of the parasite in stead of the host.

title: Grazing
desc: If G Graze[Zn] = 1, grazers have access to that zone regardless of crop stage; otherwise only if G_Graze Offseason? = 1 and crop stage = 0; The G_GrazingCycle determines the cycle in days at which animals graze the simulated patch, with G_GrazingCycle*Stockingrate as number, SLU as weight and G DayDemp[Comp] as daily requirement for DW, N and P, respectively

title: Rain Type 1
desc: Daily precipitation data

title: Soil Tillage
desc: Soil tillage will move organic inputs from the soil surface to the soil organic matter pools. You can specify the years and day-of-year's that this will happen, as well as the zones to which it will apply. There is also an option to plough a fixed number of days before each new crop is planted.

title: Prunning Event
desc:
Pruning event determined by tree LAI. Trees will be pruned if TotalTreeLAI >T_PrunLimit
 total tree LAI in crop zones >PrunLimit  and crop stage is < Prun_StageLimit

title: Initial C & N in Litter Pool
Initial C & N in SOM Pool
desc: Three methods are provided for initializing the soil organic matter pools: for MC_SOMInitType = 1 the user can specify all pool sizes for all zones, for MC_SOMInitType = 2 the user can specify the size of all pools relative to those for a forest soil ](Cref) that is calculated from soil texture data, for MC_SOMInitType = 3 the user specifies the Corg and Cref directly, but otherwise follows the procedure of  Type 2

title: SOM Distribution
desc: SOM distribution by layer (relative)

title: Litter Quality
desc: Organic inputs, including tree and cropp lignin  and polyphenol content

title: Other factors affecting decomposition
desc: Other factors affecting decomposition and soil texture. Clay and Silt content are also affecting decomposition.  Their value are automatically the same as initial value for pedotransfer.
